@Override public void robotPeriodic() { //gets the double angle = gyro.getAngle(); double rate = gyro.getRate(); updateNetworkTables(); //adds the gyro to smart dashboard SmartDashboard.putNumber("Gyro Angle", angle); SmartDashboard.putNumber("Gyro Rate", rate); }
I am trying to add a ADXRS450-b Gyro to smart dashboard but it doesn’t seem to work (i know almost nothing about java and this is my first time programing a first bot) what am I doing wrong?https://github.com/Team1157/robot-code-kcmt-2024

When you say it doesn’t seem to work, could you please describe exactly what does happen, and what you expected to happen? Does anything show up on the dashboard at all?

You might like to try adding:

SmartDashboard.putBoolean("Gyro Connected", gyro.isConnected());

Once you get this working, you may need to know that ADXRS450_Gyro.getAngle and getRate are clockwise-positive, whereas most WPILIB code uses the reverse convention.

public void disabledInit() {
    // Cleanup when disabled (e.g., close the gyro)
    gyro.close();
}

Ah. I think your problem may be here. Remember that disabledInit is called first, because the robot starts in the disabled state. I don’t think you need to be calling close on the gyro.

How much drift are you seeing? You may find this thread useful:

ADXRS450 Gyro Drift C/C++
On my robot we I use a ADXRS450 Gyroscope. It connects fine and displays the angle fine through SmartDashboard. The issue is that there is significant drift that messes up our autonomous code. We reset and calibrate it on RobotInit and have gyro.Calibrate() set to a controller button, but it still has drift after calibration. My code is available here, and the gyro is mentioned in robot.cpp, drive.h, drive.cpp, and robotcontainer.cpp Any help on how to stop the drift is appreciated.
